PAD_RecogniseWatchword.synopsis: The Sharran Inquisitor's diary documents the Harper Spy's interrogation. The spy is quoted reciting a Harper Watchword during the interrogation. Players that pass a History Check will recognise the watchword, and understand that the Light spell is required to bypass the spy's trap

PAD_RecogniseStashLocation.synopsis: The party has read a Harper's letter and has arrived where they expect their stash to be.
PAD_RecogniseStashLocation.how_to_trigger: Approach the location of the hidden Harper stash (-681; -6; 377) after reading the Sharran Inquisitor's diary (S_UND_HarperSpy_InquisitorDiary).

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.synopsis: Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird.--------When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.how_to_trigger: Successfully recognise the Harper rune at -686; -6; 374 using a History check, or by reading S_UND_HarperSpy_InquisitorDiary_d28ea463-d12a-4474-aea9-ee923382af83

PAD_FoundRune.synopsis: Party discovers a strange marking. They may or may not recognise it as a Harper symbol.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: After examining the session descriptions and their trigger conditions, two key relationships emerge. First, the session PAD_KnowStashIsHidden is described as following directly from either PAD_RecogniseStashLocation or PAD_FoundRune – meaning that the event confirming that the stash is hidden only occurs if one of these two sessions has already been triggered. This establishes ordering constraints: PAD_RecogniseStashLocation should come before PAD_KnowStashIsHidden, and PAD_FoundRune should come before PAD_KnowStashIsHidden. Second, both PAD_RecogniseStashLocation and PAD_FoundRune are triggered based on visiting the same area (their coordinate targets are identical) and represent alternative ways for the party to learn about the stash (one by reading a Harper letter and the other by discovering a mysterious marking). Because only one of these approaches is expected to occur in a given playthrough, these two sessions are mutually exclusive. The PAD_RecogniseWatchword session, although triggered by reading the same diary that underlies PAD_RecogniseStashLocation, serves a different narrative purpose (recognizing a watchword) and does not impose additional ordering constraints with respect to the stash-location-related sessions (other than the common requirement of having read the diary), so it is not included in the ordering or exclusiveness rules here.
